replies.msg:
James Rodriguez hopes to make loan to Bayern Munich stay permanent

Bayern Munich's James Rodriguez has said he wants to stay at Bayern Munich after his loan spell from Real Madrid comes to an end.

"I'm doing very well, it's a good league in Germany and the stadiums are packed. I arrived with a different perception," James told reporters after Bayern's 3-1 win over relegated Cologne at the weekend.

According to Don Balon, Real Madrid supremo Florentino Perez is all set for a blockbuster summer transfer window. The Spanish daily has reported that Perez has sanctioned a €500 million war chest for Zinedine Zidane which will see the arrival of three high profile signings.

It is reported that Real Madrid want Neymar, Mohamed Salah and Fabian Ruiz this summer. Also, Perez is ready to offload Gareth Bale and Karim Benzema to create a new attacking trio of Neymar, Ronaldo and Salah up front.

Real Madrid hope to sign Neymar for €300 million, Salah for around €200 million and are looking to sign the Real Betis midfielder Fabian Ruiz on a free transfer by offering Dani Ceballos in return.

Real Madrid to open Bernabeu doors for Champions League final


Now that Real Madrid have awarded the bulk of their Champions League final tickets to club members, they have confirmed the opening of the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu for the game.

Social director Jose Luis Sanchez has announced that further details will be released in due course as to how fans can watch the clash with Liverpool from the Madrid arena.

And it is not the first time the club have hosted those who cannot make it to the game itself, with several big screens to be set up around the Bernabeu on May 26.

replies.msg:
REAL PLOTTING ALISSON BID

Real Madrid are plotting a bid for Roma goalkeeper Alisson Becker, reports Radio Montecarlo.

Madrid have been linked with a string of goalkeepers over the past few years and Alisson, 25, is believed to be one of the prime targets on their shortlist at the moment.

Radio Montecarlo reports that they are preparing to make an offer for the Brazil international imminently and that the European champions want to finalise the deal before the end of this summer’s World Cup.

It is believed Roma would seek a fee of around €60m for the goalkeeper.

PSG PLAYERS WISE TO NEYMAR

Some of Neymar’s team-mates are aware of his desire to join Real Madrid, reports Le Parisien.

The Brazil international made a world-record move to PSG from Barcelona last summer but has been linked heavily with a switch to Real Madrid over the past few months.

According to Le Parisien, Neymar dined with his PSG team-mates Thiago Silva, Marco Verratti, Yuri Berchiche, Javier Pastore, Marquinhos and Thiago Motta on Wednesday and failed to hide his desire to move to the Spanish capital.

The dinner was organise by club captain Silva in order to celebrate the team’s recent French Cup triumph.
